org.apache.flink.api.common.operators.util

Class OperatorUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.api.common.operators.util.OperatorUtil

  • public class OperatorUtil
extends Object
    Convenience methods when dealing with Operators.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OperatorUtil() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Class<? extends Operator> getContractClass(Class<?> stubClass)
      Returns the associated Operator type for the given RichFunction class.
      static int getNumInputs(Class<? extends Operator<?>> contractType)
      Returns the number of inputs for the given Operator type.
      Currently, it can be 0, 1, or 2.
      static void setInputs(Operator<?> contract, List<List<Operator>> inputs)
      Sets the inputs of the given Operator.
      Currently, the list can have 0, 1, or 2 elements and the number of elements must match the type of the contract.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getContractClass

        public static Class<? extends Operator> getContractClass(Class<?> stubClass)
        Returns the associated Operator type for the given RichFunction class.
        Parameters:
        stubClass - the stub class
        Returns:
        the associated Operator type

      • getNumInputs

        public static int getNumInputs(Class<? extends Operator<?>> contractType)
        Returns the number of inputs for the given Operator type.
        Currently, it can be 0, 1, or 2.
        Parameters:
        contractType - the type of the Operator
        Returns:
        the number of input contracts

      • setInputs

        public static void setInputs(Operator<?> contract,
                             List<List<Operator>> inputs)
        Sets the inputs of the given Operator.
        Currently, the list can have 0, 1, or 2 elements and the number of elements must match the type of the contract.
        Parameters:
        contract - the Operator whose inputs should be set
        inputs - all input contracts to this contract
